instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello.
I have a question for you:-). 
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP which takes 5 v. and 0.495 amp on one port and 20v and 0.120 on the other port. The machine had some liquid, but is not significantly damaged. It is shorted on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> and pp3v3_s2_WLBT__ISNS and gets a bit hot seen on thermal cam. Aprox. 40 celcius at UL000, CL022, CL023, RL005 and in the surrounding area. Could it be UL000 that is short-circuited (no cracks, burnings or anything)? I have applied 1v and 0.800 amp directly in <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL> nothing gets hot. I apologize if I ask a stupid question but I am rookie

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Slowly increase the voltage; no more than 4V.
Set the amp limit to max on PSU first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi again 2informatiocos and others.
4 volt and 5 amp.... goes to 0.300 amp but get only fairly hot under UL000. If I remove the RD810 I get 20 volt and stable 0.000 amp. I've searched for a similar problem here in forum and found this one - could it be the same issue - <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> short? I will write the good guy...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you have 5A limit PSU?
Doesn't help for voltage injection!
Get 20A one, or at least 10A.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have the Peaktech 6070 which has been used for cellphone... But I see I need to upgrade. I have an old one which can power up so I will try that one and let you know:)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message: by the way... which DCP do you have? I need a new one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> M1 MBP Short <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I have cheap 0-24V/20A, aluminium case.
Lot of them available on Aliexpress.
You can find with adjustable current too; not really needed, but shows the consumption.

For 100-150€ you can get digital model, with 4 memories.
